meanings.sent1: The toy was destructible, so it broke easily when dropped.
meanings.sent2: Glass is a destructible material that can shatter if mishandled.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so destructible that it disappeared in seconds at the party.
meanings.sent4: His trust in her was as destructible as a sandcastle in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The paper was so destructible that even a gentle breeze tore it apart.

meanings.definition: Able to be broken down or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge was destructible and needed urgent repairs.
meanings.sent2: Plastic bags are destructible and harm the environment if not disposed of properly.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animals were so destructible that they popped with a single touch.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as destructible as fragile glass after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle was destructible, crumbling under the weight of the waves.
